provenance:
Prince Wenzel Paar, Vienna (1793–d. 1812)[1]; by descent, Vienna (until 1948; sold to Wildenstein); [Wildenstein and Co., New York, 1948–78; sold to Mia]

[1] The sitter was the daughter of Prince Johann Joseph Paar (1719-1792) and Countess Antonia Esterhazy (1719-1771), and the wife of Count Johann Josef Bucquoi (died 1803). The portrait was commissioned by the sitter's brother, Prince Wenzel Paar, with whose descendants it remained for over a century.
signed: LR: L.E. Vigée-Le Brun, à Vienne 1793
title: Portrait of Countess Maria Theresia Bucquoi, née Parr
